SENT.plain: During early infancy, the Apert skull is literally wide open

It is characterized by a gaping midline calvarial defect that extends almost from the root of the nose through the metopic suture area, anterior fontanelle, and sagittal suture area to a widely patent posterior fontanelle
Only the coronal suture area is prematurely fused
During the first 2 to 4 years of life, bony islands that have formed in the midline enlarge and coalesce, obliterating the midline calvarial defect without any evidence of suture formation
